conclusion: The process consists of two parts: A to B and B to C.
Process A to B is isochoric since V_A = V_B = 6 x 10^-3 m^3.
For an ideal gas, pV = nRT. T_B = (p_B/p_A) T_A = 600 K.
Work done during an isochoric process is W_AB = 0.
Change in internal energy ΔU_AB = n C_V (600 - 300) = 300 n C_V.
Heat transferred Q_AB = ΔU_AB + W_AB = 300 n C_V.
The process is a straight line from B to C in the p-V diagram.
The work done is the area under the curve, negative since volume decreases.
The area of the trapezoid is 1000 J. Work done by the gas is W_BC = -1000 J.
Temperature at C is T_C = 300 K using nR = 2 J/K.
Change in internal energy ΔU_BC = n C_V (300 - 600) = -300 n C_V.
Heat transferred Q_BC = ΔU_BC + W_BC = -300 n C_V - 1000.
Total heat transferred Q_ABC = Q_AB + Q_BC = -1000 J.
The question asks for heat transferred by the gas to the surroundings.
Heat transferred by the gas is -Q_ABC = 1000 J.
The final answer is 1000 J.
